授業目的: This course is designed to provide students with a foundational understanding of theories, concepts, and practices of organizational behavior. An organization is a collection of people who work together to achieve individual and organizational goals. In the future, most of the students will engage in some organizations either as owners, managers, or employees. So, it is important to understand how people behave in an organizational setting. In this course, students will learn how individuals and groups act in organizations and how organizations respond to the rapid changes in their external environment.
到達目標:
Upon successful completion of this course, students will be able to:
a) Understand the concepts and theories of Organizational Behavior (OB)
b) Identify and evaluate contemporary OB challenges faced by managers.
c) Comprehend OB from three levels: the individual, the group, and the organization.
d) Apply the theories of OB to analyze the organizational environment and solve case studies.
e) Facilitate group discussions and team work on issues relevant to OB.
f) Communicate their findings clearly and effectively using a variety of media.
授業方法:
Classes of this course will be conducted face-to-face in the classroom. The online class participants will receive online simultaneous interactive delivery during class time.

Teaching and learning methods would be a mixture of lectures, readings, and in-class exercises such as chapter cases, team discussions, and student presentations of cases. In every session, we will cover a particular chapter from the textbook. In general, each session is divided into two halves. In the first half, I typically follow a conventional lecture-based approach covering the concepts and theories of the relevant chapter. The second half is normally devoted to related group exercise or chapter case analysis.
